verses.name: Acts 8:30
verses.text: And Philip ran thither to him, and heard him read the prophet Esaias, and said, Understandest thou what thou readest?

verses.name: Acts 8:31
verses.text: And he said, How can I, except some man should guide me? And he desired Philip that he would come up and sit with him.

verses.name: Acts 8:32
verses.text: The place of the scripture which he read was this, He was led as a sheep to the slaughter; and like a lamb dumb before his shearer, so opened he not his mouth:

verses.name: Acts 8:33
verses.text: In his humiliation his judgment was taken away: and who shall declare his generation? for his life is taken from the earth.
